conclusion: Introduction to the problem with a uniformly dense sphere and a point mass.
Recall of Newton's law of universal gravitation.
Calculation of initial gravitational force between the sphere and point mass.
Acknowledgment that part of the sphere is removed, affecting gravitational force.
Calculation of the volume of the original sphere and the removed sphere.
Determination of the mass of the removed sphere using volume ratio.
Calculation of the remaining mass after removal.
Consideration of gravitational effects due to removed mass.
Total gravitational force is the force due to the original sphere minus the force due to the removed sphere.
Consideration of the position of the removed sphere and its effect.
Assumption about the center of the removed sphere and its gravitational influence.
Reflection on the contradiction of the removed sphere's position.
Confusion about the position of the removed sphere and its gravitational effect.
Re-examination of the problem statement for clarity.
Assumption about the location of the removed sphere based on the problem statement.
